nodes.content:
Work and Reflection (2025-02-15)
### 8:00 AM - Starting the Day
I woke up feeling a little bit tired this morning, but I knew I had a lot to do, so I pushed myself to get moving. I started by reviewing the progress I’ve made in my research over the past week. ...

Quiz Day (2025-02-11)
The day started with a knot of anxiety in my stomach, as it always does before quizzes, but the smell of freshly brewed morning coffee from the kitchen downstairs helped to soothe my nerves a little. ...

Research Milestone (2025-02-12)
What a day! I finally made a significant breakthrough with my research model! After countless hours of debugging and experimenting, I’ve been tweaking the neural network architecture and hyperparameters for weeks now, and it’s finally showing genuinely promising results. ...

Errands and Research (2025-02-13)
The day started with a quick dash to run a few essential errands before the lab got too busy. I had to pick up some groceries for the week – mostly healthy snacks and ingredients for simple dinners – and also get a few lab supplies that were running low, specifically those specialized petri dishes we use for cell culturing experiments for another side-project. ...

Valentine's Day with Friends (2025-02-14)
Started the day as usual, with a solid couple of hours of dedicated research before the afternoon’s Valentine's Day plans took over.  I decided to use the morning to dive into some new research papers related to my neuroscience project. ...

Research Update (2025-02-01)
Spent the entire afternoon completely focused on working on my primary research project. I dedicated the time to tackling a particularly persistent issue I’ve been facing with my Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) model.  ...

Study Session with Friends (2025-02-02)
Headed to the main university library this afternoon for a pre-quiz study session with my usual physics study group, consisting of Liam and Sarah. We specifically decided to focus on going over complex physics problems in preparation for the upcoming Physics 2 quiz scheduled for next week. ...

Errands Day (2025-02-03)
Dedicated a significant chunk of today to just getting necessary errands done and out of the way early in the week.  First thing in the morning, I went grocery shopping at the local supermarket, stocking up on essential groceries for the week ahead - mainly healthy lunch and dinner ingredients. ...

Physics 2 Quiz Prep (2025-02-04)
Spent a focused block of time today specifically dedicated to preparing for the upcoming Physics 2 quiz this Friday.  I methodically reviewed the core concepts of Coulomb’s Law and Gauss’s law in detail from the textbook and my lecture notes, working through example problems step-by-step. ...

Dinner with Julia (2025-02-05)
Had a thoroughly enjoyable and intellectually stimulating dinner with my friend Julia this evening at her apartment. We decided to try out a new and somewhat ambitious charcuterie board recipe she found online.  ...

Research Collaboration (2025-02-06)
Had a very productive and insightful meeting with Dr. Ramirez, a senior colleague in the Neuroscience department, to seriously discuss a potential formal collaboration on my current neuroscience research project.  ...

Physical Therapy (2025-02-07)
Took a necessary and deliberate chunk of time off from focused academic work today to prioritize my physical well-being and specifically focus on attending my regular physical therapy session. ...

Weekend Trip (2025-02-08)
Finally embarked on a long-awaited weekend trip with a close group of friends! We drove out to a nearby city we hadn't explored before – Ashtonville.  ...

Weekend Reflection (2025-02-09)
Spending a quiet Sunday afternoon reflecting on the past weekend trip to Ashtonville.  Looking back at all the fun activities and relaxed moments, I genuinely realized and appreciated just how much I inherently enjoy exploring new places and experiencing different environments. ...

nodes.id: Web Development Challenges and Personal Reflections (2025-02-10)
nodes.content:
Web Development Challenges and Personal Reflections (2025-02-10)
**10:30 AM:** Started the day diving straight into a frustrating and unexpected issue with my web development side project.  While rigorously testing cross-browser compatibility, I discovered that Chrome, unlike Safari, inexplicably does not properly support 2D matrices for WebGPU – a core functionality I’m heavily relying on for the real-time diffusion features. ...

Debugging Deep Dive (2025-01-16)
### 9:00 AM - Morning Code Review
Started the day by revisiting the diffusion model code. I noticed some inconsistencies in the loss function calculation from yesterday's training run. ...

Advisor Meeting Prep (2025-01-17)
### 10:00 AM - Reviewing Research Progress
Started the morning by thoroughly reviewing all the research progress from the past week, especially the recent debugging and regularization experiments. ...

Advisor Meeting and Weekend Kickoff (2025-01-18)
### 10:00 AM - Advisor Meeting
Had my meeting with my advisor this morning. Presented the research progress, including the debugging efforts and regularization experiments. ...

Hiking and Nature Break (2025-01-19)
### 9:00 AM - Morning Hike
Woke up early and went on a hike with friends to a nearby state park. The weather was crisp and sunny, perfect for a winter hike. ...

Data Augmentation Implementation (2025-01-20)
### 9:00 AM - Starting the Week
Started the week by reviewing notes from the advisor meeting and the data augmentation research I did on Saturday. ...

Interpretability Exploration (2025-01-21)
### 9:00 AM - Morning - Interpretability Research
Started the day by diving into research papers and online resources on model interpretability techniques, as suggested by my advisor. ...

SHAP Implementation and Comparison (2025-01-22)
### 9:00 AM - Morning - SHAP Research and Setup
Continued my exploration of model interpretability by focusing on SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations).  Read research papers and documentation to understand the theoretical foundations of SHAP and its advantages over LIME. ...

Research Report Draft (2025-01-23)
### 9:00 AM - Morning - Report Outline
Started the day by outlining the structure of a research report summarizing the progress made over the past few weeks. ...

Physics Study Group - Torque Focus (2025-01-24)
### 4:00 PM - Physics Study Group Meeting
Attended the planned physics study group session with Liam and Sarah. We specifically focused on practicing torque problems related to electric fields, as previously identified as a challenging area. ...

nodes.id: Research Report Finalization and Weekend Start (2025-01-25)
nodes.content:
Research Report Finalization and Weekend Start (2025-01-25)
### 10:00 AM - Morning - Report Revision
Spent the morning revising and expanding the research report draft. Focused on incorporating feedback from my self-review yesterday, especially expanding the discussion of interpretability findings and adding a section on limitations and future work. ...

Downtime and Personal Projects (2025-01-26)
### 10:00 AM - Slow Morning - Personal Reading
Started the day with a slow morning, enjoying a cup of coffee and reading a novel for pleasure, unrelated to my academic work. ...

nodes.id: Report Feedback and New Research Direction (2025-01-27)
nodes.content:
Report Feedback and New Research Direction (2025-01-27)
### 9:00 AM - Checking Email - Advisor Feedback
Started the week by checking email and found feedback from my advisor on the research report I submitted on Saturday.  She was positive about the progress and report quality, but suggested exploring a new research direction focused on time-series forecasting using Transformer networks, related to the interpretability insights. ...

Transformer Model Implementation (2025-01-28)
### 9:00 AM - Morning - Data Preprocessing for Transformers
Started the day focusing on data preprocessing steps required for feeding my research data into the Transformer model. Transformers often require specific input formats, including positional encodings.  ...

Transformer Training and Optimization (2025-01-29)
### 9:00 AM - Morning - Analyzing Transformer Training
Started the day by analyzing the results of the initial Transformer model training run from yesterday. The model was training, but validation performance was not yet significantly better than the RNN models. ...

Revisiting RNN Optimization (2025-01-30)
### 9:00 AM - Morning - RNN Re-evaluation
Started the day by taking a step back and re-evaluating if focusing solely on Transformers is the optimal research direction. Reviewed my previous work and notes on RNN model optimizations.  ...

Month End Reflection and Planning (2025-01-31)
### 10:00 AM - Month End Review
Started the last day of January by reviewing my notes and progress from the entire month.  Looked back at research milestones, challenges faced, skills learned, and personal reflections.  ...

Debugging Deep Dive (2025-01-16)
### 9:00 AM - Morning Code Review
Started the day by revisiting the diffusion model code. I noticed some inconsistencies in the loss function calculation from yesterday's training run. ...

### 10:00 AM - Reviewing Research Progress
Started the morning by thoroughly reviewing all the research progress from the past week, especially the recent debugging and regularization experiments. ...
